New Records: The Kansas City Royals are the first team in baseball history to make the playoffs after posting a 106-loss season the previous year.
Bobby Witt Jr. became the first shortstop in major league history with multiple seasons of at least 30 homers and 30 steals.
Key Match Events: The Kansas City Royals clinched an AL wild card despite a 3-0 loss to the Atlanta Braves.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
General manager J.J. Picollo didn’t break the bank to build a winner.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals finally popped the champagne corks in the visitors’ clubhouse at Truist Park when the Minnesota Twins were eliminated with a 7-2 loss to the Baltimore Orioles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals are headed to the postseason for the first time since winning the 2015 World Series.
Bobby Witt Jr. tops the majors with 210 hits and a.332 average, to go along with 32 homers, 109 RBIs and 31 stolen bases.
Others: The Royals quickly fell on hard times after claiming back-to-back AL pennants in 2014 and ‘15 and their first World Series title in 30 years.
The Royals made the playoffs even after losing first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino, who had 97 RBIs before breaking his right thumb and undergoing surgery.
